title: ES Cells   schema
description: Pluripotent stem cells isolated from the inner cell mass of an organism's blastocyst, able to be maintained in culture indefinitely in the pluripotent state, while remaining genetically homogenous.

ES_Name.title: ES_Name
ES_Name.description: The name of the Embryonic Stem Cells

ES_Name.schema:description: The name of the Embryonic Stem Cells

items.description: Other relevant names

items.schema:description: Other relevant names

items.description: Other relevant IDs for cells

items.title: ES_Center_Canonical_ID
items.description: LINCS center-specific canonical ID.

items.description: List of references (with PMIDs) of relevance to cell isolation, etc.

items.description: LINCS center using the cell

items.title: ES_Provider_Name
items.description: Name of vendor or lab (provider) that supplied the embryonic stem cells

items.schema:description: Name of vendor or lab (provider) that supplied the embryonic stem cells

items.title: ES_Provider_Catalog_ID
items.description: ID or catalogue number assigned to the embryonic stem cells by the vendor or provider

items.description: Vendor/Provider batch ID number; Batch or lot number assigned to the cell by the vendor or provider

items.schema:description: Vendor/Provider batch ID number; Batch or lot number assigned to the cell by the vendor or provider

items.title: ES_Comments
items.description: DSGC Comments regarding reagent
items.schema:name: ES_Comments
items.schema:description: DSGC Comments regarding reagent

ES_Organism.title: ES_Organism
ES_Organism.description: Organism of origin; A controlled vocabulary describing the organism from which the Embryonic Stem Cells were derived (e.g. Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, etc.)
ES_Organism.schema:name: ES_Organism
ES_Organism.schema:description: Organism of origin; A controlled vocabulary describing the organism from which the Embryonic Stem Cells were derived (e.g. Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, etc.)

ES_Disease.title: ES_Disease
ES_Disease.description: If the embryonic stem cells came from a particular diseased organism, the disease should be noted in terms of a controlled vocabulary (e.g. breast cancer, colon cancer, not diseased, etc.)
ES_Disease.schema:name: ES_Disease
ES_Disease.schema:description: If the embryonic stem cells came from a particular diseased organism, the disease should be noted in terms of a controlled vocabulary (e.g. breast cancer, colon cancer, not diseased, etc.)

ES_Disease_Detail.title: ES_Disease_Detail
ES_Disease_Detail.description: Additional description of a disease related to the cell that may not be available in the disease ontology above
ES_Disease_Detail.schema:name: ES_Disease_Detail
ES_Disease_Detail.schema:description: Additional description of a disease related to the cell that may not be available in the disease ontology above

items.title: ES_Known_Mutations
items.description: Mutations inherent in cell, captured explicitly; e.g. if reference is not available

branches.source: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes
branches.name: Mutations

items.schema:name: ES_Known_Mutations
items.schema:description: Mutations inherent in cell, captured explicitly; e.g. if reference is not available

items.title: ES_Mutation_Citations
items.description: Mutations inherent in the cells; From a reference
items.schema:name: ES_Mutation_Citations
items.schema:description: Mutations inherent in the cells; From a reference

items.title: ES_Molecular Features
items.description: Relevant molecular and morphological features of the embryonic stem cells (e.g. ER Status)
items.schema:name: ES_Molecular Features
items.schema:description: Relevant molecular and morphological features of the embryonic stem cells (e.g. ER Status)

ES_Genetic_Modification.title: ES_Genetic_Modification
ES_Genetic_Modification.description: Stable transfection, viral transduction or any other genetic modifications (de novo mutations, translocations) that were acquired. If yes, the modifications (e.g. expressing GFP-tagged protein) should be described and appropriate references provided.
ES_Genetic_Modification.schema:name: ES_Genetic_Modification
ES_Genetic_Modification.schema:description: Stable transfection, viral transduction or any other genetic modifications (de novo mutations, translocations) that were acquired. If yes, the modifications (e.g. expressing GFP-tagged protein) should be described and appropriate references provided.

ES_Recommended_Culture_Conditions.title: ES_Recommended_Culture_Conditions
ES_Recommended_Culture_Conditions.description: The culture conditions that are recommended by the vendor when handling the embryonic stem cells
ES_Recommended_Culture_Conditions.schema:name: ES_Recommended_Culture_Conditions
ES_Recommended_Culture_Conditions.schema:description: The culture conditions that are recommended by the vendor when handling the embryonic stem cells

items.title: ES_Related_Projects
items.description: Other projects in which the embryonic stem cells have been studied / used; A controlled vocabulary describing other large scale projects in which the embryonic stem cells has been used (e.g. ENCODE, TCGA, ICBP, Epigenomics, etc.)
items.schema:name: ES_Related_Projects
items.schema:description: Other projects in which the embryonic stem cells have been studied / used; A controlled vocabulary describing other large scale projects in which the embryonic stem cells has been used (e.g. ENCODE, TCGA, ICBP, Epigenomics, etc.)

items.title: ES_Cell_Markers
items.description: A controlled vocabulary describing the markers used to isolate / identify the cell type

branches.source: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes
branches.name: Cell Markers - Flow Cytometry

items.schema:name: ES_Cell_Markers
items.schema:description: A controlled vocabulary describing the markers used to isolate / identify the cell type

ES_Gonosome_Code.title: ES_Gonosome_Code
ES_Gonosome_Code.description: List of the sex chomosomes (gonosome) of the sample e.g. XX, XY, XXY
ES_Gonosome_Code.schema:name: ES_Gonosome_Code
ES_Gonosome_Code.schema:description: List of the sex chomosomes (gonosome) of the sample e.g. XX, XY, XXY

ES_Precursor_Cell_Name.title: ES_Precursor_Cell_Name
ES_Precursor_Cell_Name.description: This field specifies the name of the parent cell line from which the cell was derived. It is left blank if this cell was not known to be derived from another. The particular batch of that parent line that was used to generate the new line should be specified in the production details (canonical) field.
ES_Precursor_Cell_Name.schema:name: ES_Precursor_Cell_Name
ES_Precursor_Cell_Name.schema:description: This field specifies the name of the parent cell line from which the cell was derived. It is left blank if this cell was not known to be derived from another. The particular batch of that parent line that was used to generate the new line should be specified in the production details (canonical) field.

ES_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID.title: ES_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID
ES_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID.description: This field specifies the global LINCS ID of the parent cell from which the cell was derived. It is left blank if this cell line was not known to be derived from another. The particular batch of the parent line that was used to generate the new line should be specified in the production details (canonical) field.
ES_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID.schema:name: ES_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID
ES_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID.schema:description: This field specifies the global LINCS ID of the parent cell from which the cell was derived. It is left blank if this cell line was not known to be derived from another. The particular batch of the parent line that was used to generate the new line should be specified in the production details (canonical) field.

ES_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID.title: ES_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID
ES_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID.description: If this cell is derived from another registered cell, this field should specify the center LINCS Batch ID of the specific batch from which it was derived.
ES_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID.schema:name: ES_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID
ES_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID.schema:description: If this cell is derived from another registered cell, this field should specify the center LINCS Batch ID of the specific batch from which it was derived.

items.title: ES_Production_Details
items.description: This field specifies the procedure(s) by which the cells were derived from the parent/precursor cell, including genetic transformations and phenotypic selections. Citations / source information for constructs and citations for procedures should be included here when appropriate.
items.schema:name: ES_Production_Details
items.schema:description: This field specifies the procedure(s) by which the cells were derived from the parent/precursor cell, including genetic transformations and phenotypic selections. Citations / source information for constructs and citations for procedures should be included here when appropriate.

items.title: ES_Quality_Verification
items.description: Information pertaining to experimental verification of the ESC; Batch-specific ID; STR profile
items.schema:name: ES_Quality_Verification
items.schema:description: Information pertaining to experimental verification of the ESC; Batch-specific ID; STR profile

items.title: ES_Passage_Number
items.description: The number of times that the embryonic stem cells had been passaged
items.schema:name: ES_Passage_Number
items.schema:description: The number of times that the embryonic stem cells had been passaged

items.title: ES_Source_Information
items.description: This is a free-text field that provides detailed source information for this particular batch, which may include information on from whom and when the provider obtained the cells and for what purpose the cells were obtained by the end user.
items.schema:name: ES_Source_Information
items.schema:description: This is a free-text field that provides detailed source information for this particular batch, which may include information on from whom and when the provider obtained the cells and for what purpose the cells were obtained by the end user.

items.title: ES_Date_Received
items.description: This field specifies when this batch was obtained from the provider. Because YEAR-MO-DY is not always known, this field may only contain partial date information (e.g. YEAR-MO, YEAR only).
items.schema:name: ES_Date_Received
items.schema:description: This field specifies when this batch was obtained from the provider. Because YEAR-MO-DY is not always known, this field may only contain partial date information (e.g. YEAR-MO, YEAR only).

items.title: ES_Center_Specific_Code
items.description: LINCS center-specific coded information that can include in its format information regarding the parent / protocol used / date
items.schema:name: ES_Center_Specific_Code
items.schema:description: LINCS center-specific coded information that can include in its format information regarding the parent / protocol used / date

items.title: ES_Passage_Last_Karyotyping
items.description: The passage number since the last karyotyping
items.schema:name: ES_Passage_Last_Karyotyping
items.schema:description: The passage number since the last karyotyping

items.title: ES_Culture_Conditions
items.description: A description of the culture conditions that were used and are suitable for this type of cell
items.schema:name: ES_Culture_Conditions
items.schema:description: A description of the culture conditions that were used and are suitable for this type of cell

schema:name: ES Cells
